author: Ruth Bloomfield
title: The Marrakesh Neighborhood the Jet-Set Call Home
text:
On the northern fringes of Marrakesh, overlooked by the Atlas Mountains, luxury hotels and vast mansions sit within a natural 54-square-mile palm grove called La Palmeraie.
Notable residents of this rarefied Moroccan enclave include the Emir of Qatar, who paid a reported $117.7 million for his vacation home. Marella Agnelli, widow of Fiat chairman Gianni Agnelli, and Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former director of the International Monetary Fund, also have homes here.
